remarks: If a word concatenated with a vertex represents a closed walk in (in a graph), there is an edge between this vertex and the last vertex of the word, and between this vertex and the first vertex of the word. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2018.)
statement: clwwlkext2edg $p |- ( ( ( W e. Word V /\ Z e. V /\ N e. ( ZZ>= ` 2 ) ) /\ ( W ++ <" Z "> ) e. ( ( V ClWWalksN E ) ` N ) ) -> ( { ( lastS ` W ) , Z } e. ran E /\ { Z , ( W ` 0 ) } e. ran E ) ) $.
